summary: This is a confidential investigative interview report prepared by T&M USA, LLC for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, summarizing a phone interview conducted on August 31, 2021, with a former assistant of Jeffrey Epstein. The interviewee, who worked for Epstein in the late 1990s, provides a positive account of Epstein and Maxwell, denies witnessing any wrongdoing, and criticizes media portrayals as false.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Subject of defense investigation, former associate of Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The interviewee describes Maxwell as a role model, states she and Epstein were not 'joined at the hip' and did not always travel together, and mentions visiting her house.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The interviewee worked as Epstein's assistant in New York in the late 1990s, describes him as nice, generous, and interested in helping people, and denies seeing any girls or girlfriends at the office or any wrongdoing.

persons.name: Menninger
persons.context: Conducted the phone interview for the investigative report, along with 'Mack'.

persons.name: Mack
persons.context: Conducted the phone interview for the investigative report, along with 'Menninger'.

connections.description: The interviewee states they were 'very good friends' and that Epstein and Maxwell were not 'joined at the hip' and did not always travel together.
The interviewee was Epstein's assistant for a few years in the late 1990s, working in his New York office, handling messages, organizing things, and planning trips.
The interviewee describes Maxwell as a 'role model' and states she had been to Maxwell's house.

events.title: Defense Team Interview of Former Epstein Assistant
events.description: A phone interview conducted by investigators Menninger and Mack for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team with a former assistant of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Interviewee Leaves Epstein Employment
events.description: The former assistant states she left her position working for Jeffrey Epstein in the year 2000.

locations: 230 Park Avenue, Suite 440, New York, NY 10169
keyFacts: A former assistant of Jeffrey Epstein, interviewed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team in 2021, vehemently denies witnessing any wrongdoing or seeing any girls/girlfriends at Epstein's New York office during her employment in the late 1990s.
The interviewee portrays Epstein and Maxwell positively, describing Epstein as 'nice' and 'generous,' helping people with education, and Maxwell as a 'role model.'
The interviewee claims the media has published false information about her, including incorrect addresses and locations like the Virgin Islands and New Mexico.

The interviewee states her duties included taking messages, organizing, planning trips, and that she had a desk right next to Epstein's office with pass-through doors, suggesting she had regular access and visibility.
The document is a privileged and confidential investigative report, indicating it was prepared for use in Ghislaine Maxwell's legal defense.
